discription: Package http provides HTTP client and server implementations.

Package autorest implements an HTTP request pipeline suitable for use across multiple go-routines and provides the shared routines relied on by AutoRest (see https://github.com/Azure/autorest/) generated Go code.
Package gin implements a HTTP web framework called gin.
Package http provides a general purpose HTTP binding for endpoints.
Package oauth2 provides support for making OAuth2 authorized and authenticated HTTP requests, as specified in RFC 6749.
Package httprouter is a trie based high performance HTTP request router.
Package promhttp provides tooling around HTTP servers and clients.
Package ctxhttp provides helper functions for performing context-aware HTTP requests.
Package http supports network connections to HTTP servers.
Package handlers is a collection of handlers (aka "HTTP middleware") for use with Go's net/http package (or any framework supporting http.Handler).
Package fasthttp provides fast HTTP server and client API.
Package chi is a small, idiomatic and composable router for building HTTP services.
Package http implements the HTTP transport protocol.
Package http implements a HTTP reporter to send spans to Zipkin V2 collectors.
Package http provides the HTTP transport client and request/response types needed to round trip API operation calls with an service.
Package fiber is an Express inspired web framework built on top of Fasthttp, the fastest HTTP engine for Go.
Package http contains HTTP specific constructs that complement the code generated by Goa.
Package resty provides Simple HTTP and REST client library for Go.
Package request contains everything around extracting info from a http request object.
Package http implements the HTTP transport protocol.
Package auth is an implementation of HTTP Basic and HTTP Digest authentication.
Package fs contains an HTTP file system that works with zip contents.
Package context provides several utilities for working with Go's context in http requests.
